@Mamaofabean Thatâ€™s what DH did when he transitioned his job at the hospital to private practice. Went from 5 days, down to 3 days, 2 days then... GONE. ðŸ‘‹ðŸ¼ Took about 6 years in total. Could have been faster but we were also busy having babies & thatâ€™s a whole other job as you know!

@Mamaofabean Except thatâ€™s not how you â€œmakeâ€ a new job :) It doesnâ€™t have to be so black/white. Donâ€™t quit your job/sell your house. Not so drastic! Just â€œnudgeâ€ in the direction you want â€œover timeâ€. It will happen in little baby steps. Then you can begin to pull away from your old job.

@Mamaofabean No, we couldnâ€™t get anything decent in NOTL on such late notice so we stayed near the Falls. First time the kids have been to the Falls so that works too. We spent most of yesterday & dinner in NOTL & will today too.

Stay in your lane cracking backs & leave the pep talks up to qualified mental healthcare professionals. #CredibilityGone

@DrBillHowrilla @KellyPediNp Are you a full or half wit? Read my bio. I work in health care. With patients who live with disabilities none of which are â€œself erectedâ€. Unless you think getting your head smashed in by a car is just them being a victim? Save your bizarre disconnected platitudes. Try empathy.

@DrBillHowrilla @KellyPediNp I would love to hear you tell someone with a physical or mental disability to just â€œrise upâ€. Uh, no bro. It doesnâ€™t work that way. Get down from your high chair & connect with them. Try empathy & support. Not everyone lives in your privilege fishbowl.

@DrBillHowrilla @KellyPediNp Education is a privilege. Herein lies the barrier for some. As a healthcare provider, you canâ€™t provide excellent healthcare if you donâ€™t even notice your patients have barriers & understand how to connect with them. Inclusivity requires you to look beyond your vantage point.

@DrBillHowrilla @KellyPediNp The problem with auggesting people just ask for help is those who lack privilege donâ€™t even know who to ask or that they should even be asking something in the first place. That takes awareness that something is even missing. Theyâ€™re no victims, just totally unaware. Know this.

@DrBillHowrilla @KellyPediNp Oh dear. Sounds like someone who hasnâ€™t experienced anything but privilege. You are welcome to experience my grade 8 educated elderly in laws from India who barely speak English. Advocate? They canâ€™t even spell it. Please. Get out more & experience beyond your bubble.
@Mamaofabean Lol! I have no idea. #SexBreaksAreTheBestBreaks

@Mamaofabean Also, men donâ€™t rape because theyâ€™re â€œsexually frustratedâ€ or donâ€™t â€œget enoughâ€. Men who rape are psychopathic assholes who crave power. A doll probably wouldnâ€™t cut it for them since it canâ€™t express fear/lose power.

@DrBillHowrilla @KellyPediNp Meaning, not everyone can simply wake up with their cape on, realize that (drumroll please) â€œthey alone are responsible for their healthâ€ ðŸ’ªðŸ¼ & advocate for themselves. To be so empowered/aware/educated/able comes from a place of privilege. Itâ€™s not that simple for everyone.
